Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: TRINSORT Process
Screen.Label: Read traces from trace files in desired order
OPT_FILE=
CHECKFILE=
HOW_READ_TRACES =
MERGE=
HISTORY=
OPT_SORT=
HDR_PRI =
PRI_INIT =
PRI_INC =
HDR_SEC =
SEC_INIT =
SEC_INC =
HDR_TERT=
TERT_INIT=
TERT_INC=
Trace Selection Criteria:
HDR_A=
A_MIN=
A_WID=
A_INC=
A_MAX=
HDR_B=
B_MIN=
B_WID=
B_INC=
B_MAX=
HDR_C=
C_MIN=
C_WID=
C_INC=
C_MAX=

Help.Tip: Source of input files.
Help.Text:
trinsort - OPT_FILE
Source of input files.
 
 Default = PATHNAMES
 Allowed = PATHNAMES, PATH_LIST
 If OPT_FILE = PATHNAMES, file(s) listed in PATHNAMES array.
 If OPT_FILE = PATH_LIST, file(s) listed in file indicated by PATH_LIST.
 When using PATHNAMES, if no file suffix is specified an appropriate file
 suffix will be added.
 When using PATH_LIST, no file suffix is added.  If the user wants file
 suffices, he/she must specify them with each entry in PATH_LIST file.

Help.Tip: Check that the file is valid trace file with consistent globals.
Help.Text:
trinsort - CHECKFILE
Check that the file is valid trace file with consistent globals.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES, NO
 CFE can check the file for consistency and existence, and in the process will
 load special globals (scalar ones) for subsequent job processes to use.
 These are so that GVS, some Migrations, etc. will have proper globals set
 by the input data.

Help.Tip: Forces more thorough file STATUS checking.
Help.Text:
trinsort - TEST_BEYOND_SYMLINKS
Forces more thorough file STATUS checking.
 
 Default behavior is to not pursue file STATUS checking beyond the symbolic
 links themselves.  Pushing this button causes more thorough file STATUS
 information to be provided.  Refrain from pushing this button during periods
 of NFS or disk problems.

Help.Tip: Choose PATHNAME using a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
trinsort - SELECT_LATEST_PATHNAME
Choose PATHNAME using a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: File status (if CHECKSTATUS=YES).
Help.Text:
trinsort - STATUS
File status (if CHECKSTATUS=YES).
 
  R  -- File found and readable.
 RE  -- File not found or not readable.
  W  -- File found and writable.
  C  -- File not found, but creatable.
 CE  -- File not found and not creatable.
 WE  -- File exists and can not be overwritten.  Checks both file and
        directory permissions.
 WB  -- Blank filename.
 NTF -- File not a trc, cmpr, or segy file (only if CHECKFILE == YES).
 BG  -- File globals disagree with job (only if CHECKFILE == YES).

Help.Tip: Pathname(s) for the file(s) to be read.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PATHNAMES
Pathname(s) for the file(s) to be read.
 
 Default = blank
 Allowed = char
 Pathname of file(s), including optional node, userid, and dir.
 When using PATHNAMES, if no file suffix is specified an appropriate file
 suffix will be added.

Help.Tip: Choose PATH_LIST with a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
trinsort - SELECT_PATH_LIST
Choose PATH_LIST with a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: ASCII file containing list of file names.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PATH_LIST
ASCII file containing list of file names.
 
 Default = blank
 Allowed = char
 When using PATH_LIST, no file suffix is added.  If the user wants file
 suffices, he/she must specify them with each entry in PATH_LIST file.

Help.Tip: File status for PATH_LIST.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PATH_LIST_INFO
File status for PATH_LIST.
 
 Pathname of ASCII list file.

Help.Tip: Choose TABLEPATH using a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
trinsort - SELECT_TABLEPATH
Choose TABLEPATH using a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: Name of trace file table to use.
Help.Text:
trinsort - TABLEPATH
Name of trace file table to use.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char or NONE
 
 This trace file table must match the specified trace files.
 
 Any specified file extension will be changed to ".table".
 
 TABLEPATH must NOT be specified if HOW_READ_TRACES is set to SEQUENTIAL.
 TABLEPATH must be specified if HOW_READ_TRACES is set to OLD_SORT or NEW_SORT.

Help.Tip: Status of TABLEPATH.
Help.Text:
trinsort - TABLEPATH_INFO
Status of TABLEPATH.

Help.Tip: Information regarding contents of TABLEPATH.
Help.Text:
trinsort - INFO
Information regarding contents of TABLEPATH.

Help.Tip: Whether to read traces sequentially or in a chosen order.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HOW_READ_TRACES
Whether to read traces sequentially or in a chosen order.
 
 Default = SEQUENTIAL
 Allowed = SEQUENTIAL (read traces sequentially and do not use table)
 Allowed = OLD_SORT   (read traces in old order specified on table)
 Allowed = NEW_SORT   (read traces in new order specified by parameters here)
 
 HOW_READ_TRACES must be set to SEQUENTIAL if TABLEPATH is NOT specified.
 HOW_READ_TRACES must be set to OLD_SORT or NEW_SORT if TABLEPATH is specified.
 
 For OLD_SORT, if the trace file table has not been sorted into a new trace
 file table, the trace order will be the original trace order when the
 trace file table was created.

Help.Tip: Whether to merge traces with those from previous processes.
Help.Text:
trinsort - MERGE
Whether to merge traces with those from previous processes.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = NO     (Do not merge traces.)
 Allowed = APPEND (Append traces after those from previous processes.)
 
 The first process in a loop cannot be a TRINSORT with MERGE = APPEND.

Help.Tip: Whether to read histories from the files.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HISTORY
Whether to read histories from the files.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES    (Do read histories.)
 Allowed = NO     (Do not read histories.)

Help.Tip: Option for selecting common sorts or a custom sort.
Help.Text:
trinsort - OPT_SORT
Option for selecting common sorts or a custom sort.
 
 Default = CUSTOM
 Allowed = COMMON_MIDPOINT ( 8, 7, 6)
 Allowed = COMMON_SOURCE   ( 9,10, 1)
 Allowed = COMMON_RECEIVER (10, 9, 1)
 Allowed = COMMON_OFFSET   ( 6, 8, 7)
 Allowed = CUSTOM

Help.Tip: Header word designating primary sort bins.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HDR_PRI
Header word designating primary sort bins.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 
 HDR_PRI is the least rapidly changing sort header for output traces.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of ANY primary sort bin.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PRI_INIT
Value for the center of ANY primary sort bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment for primary header word.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PRI_INC
Increment for primary header word.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real (but not zero)
 
 PRI_INC is the increment between, and the width of, primary sort bins.
 If PRI_INC < 0, traces will be output in descending order of HDR_PRI.

Help.Tip: Header word designating secondary sort bins.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HDR_SEC
Header word designating secondary sort bins.
 
 Default = 6
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 
 HDR_SEC has intermediate rapidity of change for output traces.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of ANY secondary sort bin.
Help.Text:
trinsort - SEC_INIT
Value for the center of ANY secondary sort bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment for secondary header word.
Help.Text:
trinsort - SEC_INC
Increment for secondary header word.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real (but not zero)
 
 SEC_INC is the increment between, and the width of, secondary sort bins.
 If SEC_INC < 0, traces will be output in descending order of HDR_SEC.

Help.Tip: Header word designating tertiary sort bins.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HDR_TERT
Header word designating tertiary sort bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 
 HDR_TERT is the most rapidly changing sort header for output traces.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of ANY tertiary sort bin.
Help.Text:
trinsort - TERT_INIT
Value for the center of ANY tertiary sort bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment for tertiary header word.
Help.Text:
trinsort - TERT_INC
Increment for tertiary header word.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real (but not zero)
 
 TERT_INC is the increment between, and the width of, tertiary sort bins.
 If TERT_INC < 0, traces will be output in descending order of HDR_TERT.

Help.Tip: Header word for selecting traces.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HDR_A
Header word for selecting traces.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 2 - NWIH (or 0 to disable selections).
 
 This header word need not match HDR_PRI or HDR_SEC or HDR_TERT.
 
 Any header word (except header word 1) can be used for trace selections,
 but if HOW_READ_TRACES is not SEQUENTIAL and the header word is on the
 TABLEPATH file, the trace selections will be faster because the selection
 criterion for that header word will be applied BEFORE attempting to read
 the trace from the file.
 
 The order of HDR_A and HDR_B and HDR_C is unimportant.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of the MINIMUM bin to select.
Help.Text:
trinsort - A_MIN
Value for the center of the MINIMUM bin to select.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Traces in bins with bin center smaller than A_MIN will be skipped.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_A is 0.

Help.Tip: Bin width for header word HDR_A.
Help.Text:
trinsort - A_WID
Bin width for header word HDR_A.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 
 This width need not bear any relationship to the bin widths (or increments)
 used for sorting.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_A is 0.

Help.Tip: Increment for header word HDR_A.
Help.Text:
trinsort - A_INC
Increment for header word HDR_A.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= A_WID
 
 This is the increment from the center of one selected bin to the center
 of the next selected bin.  If it is equal to A_WID, the selected
 bins will butt up to each other with no gap.
 
 This increment need not be a multiple of A_WID.
 
 This increment need not bear any relationship to the bin widths (or
 increments) used for sorting.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_A is 0.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of the MAXIMUM bin to select.
Help.Text:
trinsort - A_MAX
Value for the center of the MAXIMUM bin to select.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 Allowed = real >= A_MIN
 
 This should be equal to A_MIN plus a multiple of A_INC, and will be
 adjusted slightly if necessary to make this true.
 
 Traces in bins with bin center larger than A_MAX will be skipped.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_A is 0.

Help.Tip: Header word for selecting traces.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HDR_B
Header word for selecting traces.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 2 - NWIH (or 0 to disable selections).
 
 This header word need not match HDR_PRI or HDR_SEC or HDR_TERT.
 
 Any header word (except header word 1) can be used for trace selections,
 but if HOW_READ_TRACES is not SEQUENTIAL and the header word is on the
 TABLEPATH file, the trace selections will be faster because the selection
 criterion for that header word will be applied BEFORE attempting to read
 the trace from the file.
 
 The order of HDR_A and HDR_B and HDR_C is unimportant.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of the MINIMUM bin to select.
Help.Text:
trinsort - B_MIN
Value for the center of the MINIMUM bin to select.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Traces in bins with bin center smaller than B_MIN will be skipped.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_B is 0.

Help.Tip: Bin width for header word HDR_B.
Help.Text:
trinsort - B_WID
Bin width for header word HDR_B.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 
 This width need not bear any relationship to the bin widths (or increments)
 used for sorting.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_B is 0.

Help.Tip: Increment for header word HDR_B.
Help.Text:
trinsort - B_INC
Increment for header word HDR_B.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= B_WID
 
 This is the increment from the center of one selected bin to the center
 of the next selected bin.  If it is equal to B_WID, the selected
 bins will butt up to each other with no gap.
 
 This increment need not be a multiple of B_WID.
 
 This increment need not bear any relationship to the bin widths (or
 increments) used for sorting.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_B is 0.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of the MAXIMUM bin to select.
Help.Text:
trinsort - B_MAX
Value for the center of the MAXIMUM bin to select.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 Allowed = real >= B_MIN
 
 This should be equal to B_MIN plus a multiple of B_INC, and will be
 adjusted slightly if necessary to make this true.
 
 Traces in bins with bin center larger than B_MAX will be skipped.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_B is 0.

Help.Tip: Header word for selecting traces.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HDR_C
Header word for selecting traces.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 2 - NWIH (or 0 to disable selections).
 
 This header word need not match HDR_PRI or HDR_SEC or HDR_TERT.
 
 Any header word (except header word 1) can be used for trace selections,
 but if HOW_READ_TRACES is not SEQUENTIAL and the header word is on the
 TABLEPATH file, the trace selections will be faster because the selection
 criterion for that header word will be applied BEFORE attempting to read
 the trace from the file.
 
 The order of HDR_A and HDR_B and HDR_C is unimportant.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of the MINIMUM bin to select.
Help.Text:
trinsort - C_MIN
Value for the center of the MINIMUM bin to select.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Traces in bins with bin center smaller than C_MIN will be skipped.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_C is 0.

Help.Tip: Bin width for header word HDR_C.
Help.Text:
trinsort - C_WID
Bin width for header word HDR_C.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 
 This width need not bear any relationship to the bin widths (or increments)
 used for sorting.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_C is 0.

Help.Tip: Increment for header word HDR_C.
Help.Text:
trinsort - C_INC
Increment for header word HDR_C.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= C_WID
 
 This is the increment from the center of one selected bin to the center
 of the next selected bin.  If it is equal to C_WID, the selected
 bins will butt up to each other with no gap.
 
 This increment need not be a multiple of C_WID.
 
 This increment need not bear any relationship to the bin widths (or
 increments) used for sorting.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_C is 0.

Help.Tip: Value for the center of the MAXIMUM bin to select.
Help.Text:
trinsort - C_MAX
Value for the center of the MAXIMUM bin to select.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 Allowed = real >= C_MIN
 
 This should be equal to C_MIN plus a multiple of C_INC, and will be
 adjusted slightly if necessary to make this true.
 
 Traces in bins with bin center larger than C_MAX will be skipped.
 
 This value is irrelevant if HDR_C is 0.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
trinsort - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
trinsort - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
trinsort - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
trinsort - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
trinsort - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
trinsort - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
trinsort - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
trinsort - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : TRINSORT                 (TRIN with trace sort)
 Category   : io
 Written    : 2001-12-28   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Read trace files in desired sorted order using trace file table.
 Portability: No known limitations, but see note regarding pgf90 bug below.
 Parallel   : No.
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 This process reads a trace file from disk in the order specified by
 a table of the traces on the trace file.
 
 This process should be used instead of TRIN if you want to read the traces
 in an order different from the actual order of the traces on the file.
 This action may eliminate the need to sort the data using TSORT.
 
 You must have previously saved a trace file table using the TABLESAVE
 process at the time you saved the trace file itself using the TROT process.
 The trace file saved by TROT and read by this process must be a TRCIO file.
 
 Any of the header words which were saved on the table can be used to choose
 the order in which the trace data is to be read by this process.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         TRIO OF PROCESSES
 
 This process is one of a trio of processes designed to allow reading trace
 files randomly in order to reduce the need to sort data using TSORT:
 
 TABLESAVE:  Saves a trace file table to disk.  This process should
             immediately precede or follow TROT in the job.  TROT will
             save the trace file as usual.
 
 TABLESORT:  Reads, sorts, and saves a trace file table in a different
             order (setup-only process).  This is optional, since TRINSORT
             (below) can also sort (but not output) the table.
 
 TRINSORT:   Reads a trace file in desired sort order using the trace file
             table.  This process should be used instead of TRIN to read
             the trace file.  TRINSORT can read traces in the order
             specified on the table, or in a user-specified order.
 
 If you wish to create a trace file table for an existing TROT file, you
 can read the traces using TRIN followed by TABLESAVE.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
010. 2006-10-16  D. Glover  Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
  9. 2005-10-24  Stoeckley  Enhance to allow more than one trace file input;
                             add history option.
  8. 2004-03-17  Stoeckley  Change to not test for selected trace a second
                             time (after reading the trace) using a header
                             word which was used for selecting the trace the
                             first time (before reading the trace).
  7. 2003-12-09  Stoeckley  Change to double precision from real.
  6. 2002-08-01  Stoeckley  Change the trace selection algorithm to call the
                             MTH module.
  5. 2002-07-11  Stoeckley  Change the trace selection algorithm so that the
                             trace selection increment does not have to be
                             a multiple of the bin width.
  4. 2002-04-08  Stoeckley  Add ability to select traces by pattern.
  3. 2002-02-25  Stoeckley  Add MERGE parameter with options APPEND and NO.
  2. 2002-02-06  Stoeckley  Add capability to select traces while reading.
  1. 2002-02-04  Stoeckley  Initial version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
